title: Messing with me?
text: I asked it to make me a printable schedule for the day and I gave it the hours that I wanted to start and stop.   I added that I wanted to throw five bathroom breaks throughout the day in there. I was astonished at how well it did, it gave me an extra break and time to eat.   It even added some extra time for me to wind down because it could see that I was doing too many projects in one day.   I accidentally deleted the response. It gave me and it couldn‚Äôt get it back, so I asked it the same question, and it gave me the most ridiculous schedule you could ever imagine. It put five of my bathroom breaks all stacked together in the morning, and then, when I said something about it, it said yeah, that is ridiculous and then it stacked all five of the bathroom breaks at the end of the day. This went on and on and I got Frustrated, extremely strange, but overall I like it so I gave it four stars. I apologize for any typos. I am using talk text and I don‚Äôt have time to reread this goodbye. Hope it was helpful.

title: content filter
text:
I‚Äôve been using the platform for a while now and overall, I‚Äôm impressed with the features and functionality it offers. However, there‚Äôs one aspect that I believe could be improved to enhance user experience: the content filter.

While I understand the importance of maintaining a safe and respectful environment, I believe that users should have more control over their experience. Currently, there isn‚Äôt a direct way for users to instruct the content filter to not trigger. This can be frustrating, especially when innocuous or relevant content gets flagged unnecessarily.

I propose that the platform introduces a feature that allows users to have direct access to the content filter settings. This would enable users to adjust the sensitivity of the filter or even turn it off completely, giving them more control over the content they see.

Providing users with this level of control not only enhances their overall experience but also promotes a sense of autonomy and agency. Users should be empowered to customize their experience according to their preferences while still maintaining a safe and respectful environment for all.

I urge the developers to consider implementing this feature in future updates. By listening to user feedback and prioritizing user control, the platform can continue to evolve and improve, ultimately providing a better experience for all users.

Thank you for considering my feedback. I look forward to seeing how the platform continues to grow and improve in the future.

Sincerely, paul john
